jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

0205C60C645D42BE91128EC885DC3DEC.description:
Explain how environmental change in
one part of the world can affect social
justice in other parts of the world.

37C893C4F65343D7BBC79174490AA2ED.description:
Explain how an environmental change
in one part of the world can affect
places in other parts of the world over
time.

E4A6CBC6032A4EF8B118C51F3AD923A4.description:
Explain how human characteristics of a
place are influenced by acculturation
(e.g., Spanish culture in middle and
South America and the United States
Southwest, Hindu and Muslim culture
in Southeast Asia).

3FB8E6BA82974C8EB003168D95629AC3.description:
Describe how humans have adapted to
environmental changes caused by
natural processes.

F1F5A6C105E84C07B7F4F8A61388E726.description:
Describe instances of how places can
be changed or destroyed as a result of
natural processes.

008E57955A2945C794E0813E3FD83F32.description: Understand the historical significance of geography. Understand the historical significance of geography and the Church.

2BD16AC029834CEB8F2FC66E96F6C158.description:
Identify social, political, and economic
factors that attract people to, and repel
people from, urban centers.

7928BAEA74674A249EF1059B8379DA44.description:
Discuss the effects of an extreme
weather phenomenon on human
populations in different regions of the
United States and the world (e.g.,
hurricanes, flooding, tornadoes).

562C08E469964E428AEE017550E2A294.description:
Formulate several hypotheses about
relationships among resources,
manufacturing and service industries,
transportation, and population densities
in different regions of the United States
and the world.

D9C2B26A47FE4BB3A09DBBECE8F9449A.description:
Analyze physical and human
environments in Illinois and the United
States to determine ways that people
adapt to and modify their environment.

ECCA0D3D6BFB47BF9255A1F8262FCA5D.description:
Discuss the human induced changes in
relation to our Catholic responsibility.

535A0A7297EE4FEA840DEED331356BA5.description:
Identify human induced changes in
land forms, climate, natural vegetation,
and resources of their local community,
state of Illinois, nation, and the world.

4E539DFD5A7540D390DE64427638A619.description:
Explain the different patterns in
population density using geographic
tools (e.g., pyramids, maps).

AEB2FBBA3A1A4B02B688A79E0D720A9A.description: Understand relationships between geographic factors and society. Understand relationships between geographic factors, society and the Church.

A9CF264880884B6CAA5D8A6A60A70F27.description:
. Predict the effects of an extreme
weather phenomenon on the physical
environment (e.g., a hurricane’s impact
on a coastal ecosystem).

075FDBE29A4F429987A3651B6A971DA4.description:
Analyze maps to determine the
relationship among climate, natural
vegetation, and natural resources.

4F4F6FAEAE87481BBEC5660237236353.description:
Explain our moral obligation to act
responsibly as stewards of the earth.

EAED23F8566E46E39BEC7533A23E60CE.description:
Identify and describe different climates
in terms of precipitation and
temperature and the types of plants and
animals associated with each using
pictures, maps, and graphs.

F2C4DBB44C61429AA0AC8FD4246C837C.description:
Explain how Earth-Sun relationships
affect Earth’s energy balance (e.g.,
heating of soil and water at different
seasons of the year, differential heating
at different latitudes).

7E6CB309CC8A4D6CB4DEF467273FBF5C.description: Analyze and explain characteristics and interactions of the Earth’s physical systems. Analyze and explain the moral implications of our interactions with the Earth’s physical systems.

9C641E9F62614FF8912E5B7732AC8F10.description:
Explain how geographic features
impacted religious groups that
relocated to new geographic regions.

226487E271FC495F93EF4DAB88185DCC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the
spatial distribution of various
phenomena by using latitude and
longitude to plot data on a base map of
the United States or the world (e.g.,
location of professional sports teams in
the U.S. or the world).

18E13DE8A8BF4594A262DD38962A13AE.description:
Explain the purposes and
distinguishing characteristics of
selected map projections, globes, aerial
photos, and satellite images.

23A3D466C74C4E88B2AFBEBA92ACF208.description:
Develop maps and flowcharts showing
major patterns of movement of people
and commodities (e.g., international
trade in petroleum, countries that
produce and those that consume
resources, cartograms, population
pyramids).

5A06A87B0836418F935C2AC5984E3394.description:
Compare sketch maps with atlas maps
to determine the accuracy of physical
and cultural features (e.g.,
political/physical maps of Canada, the
United States, and Europe).

58E2372B119C444EB7B7DF46DEBD8197.description: Locate, describe and explain places, regions and features on the Earth. Locate, describe and explain places, regions and features of God’s creation.

AA9A00F1C01A43369730D35C35D3A088.description: Understand world geography and the effects of geography on society, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand world geography and the effects of geography and religion on society with an emphasis on the United States.
